metadata.title: CVE-2014-3005 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
XML external entity (XXE) vulnerability in Zabbix 1.8.x before 1.8.21rc1,2.0.x before 2.0.13rc1, 2.2.x before 2.2.5rc1, and 2.3.x before 2.3.2allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files or potentially executearbitrary code via a crafted DTD in an XML request.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3005` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:2.2.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:2.2.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:2.2.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:2.2.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:2.2.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:2.2.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:2.2.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:2.2.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
